param.name: MPSFilename
param.help: Filename for MPS Visit information, format: MPS_PRE_Visits.fsd

param.name: startTime
param.help: Start date and time of the simulation (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.SSS])

param.name: numberOfStackedImages
param.help: Number of stacked images to produce. Simulation duration is numberOfStackedImages*exposuresPerStack*exposureTime.

param.name: exposuresPerStack
param.help: Number of exposures per stack

param.name: exposureTime
param.help: Exposure time in seconds

param.name: repetitionPeriod
param.help: Repetition period in seconds

param.name: maxImagesPerCube
param.help: Maximum number of images per image cube

param.name: doFullFrame
param.help: Set to true to output a fits file containing a full frame image corresponding to the first exposure of the simulation

param.name: pointingRA
param.help: Pointing direction Right Ascension in arcseconds

param.name: pointingDec
param.help: Pointing direction declination in arcseconds

param.name: obsId
param.help: Observation ID

param.name: applyThroughput
param.help: Switch off to set the optical throughput to 100% for the full wavelength range

param.name: throughputFilename
param.help: filename for telescope throughput vs wavelength, format: REF_APP_Throughput.fsd

param.name: applyQE
param.help: Switch off to apply the flat field only without wavelength dependent quantum efficiency

param.name: QEFilename
param.help: filename for quantum efficiency vs wavelength, format: REF_APP_QE.fsd

param.name: SEDFilename
param.help: filename for SED reference file, format: REF_APP_SEDTeff.fsd. Any string not containing REF_APP_SEDTeff will result in a black body being used instead.

param.name: targetSEDFilename
param.help: filename for user provided SED fileto be used for the target star. Format: FITS table containing columns named WAVELENGHTH and FLUX. Units of WAVELENGTH must be Angstroms and the wavelength range must cover 3300-11000 Angstroms.

param.name: gaiaBand
param.help: Flag to indicate whether or not to use the Gaia band rather than the V-band for stellar flux normalization

param.name: gainCorrectionFilename
param.help: Filename for the REF_APP_GainCorrection fits file containing the parameters for the gain correction formula as a function of bias voltage values

param.name: radius_barycentre
param.help: Radius of circle centred on image centre used to determine PSF barycentre

param.name: radius_bkgInner
param.help: Inner radius of annulus centred on PSF barycentre used to evaluate the background

param.name: radius_bkgOuter
param.help: Outer radius of annulus centred on PSF barycentre used to evaluate the background

param.name: radius_psf
param.help: Radius of circle centred on PSF barycentre used to extract the signal flux

param.name: subtractBackground
param.help: Set to true to perform background subtraction during light curve extraction

param.name: updateDatabase
param.help: Set to true to update the CHEOPSim job submission database

param.name: modulesToRun
param.help: Comma separated list of modules to be run

param.name: redundantHardware
param.help: Flag to indicate whether or not to use the redundant right amplifier rather than left amplifier for CCD readout

param.name: strayLightThreshold
param.help: Stray light threshold for writing out images in photons/s/pixel, to apply when not defined in MPS_PRE_Visits

param.name: singleTemperaturePSF
param.help: Set to true if the PSF is provided for a single temperature rather than for four thermal cases

param.name: psfTemperature
param.help: Temperature corresponding to the PSF

param.name: oversampledPsf
param.help: Flag to indicate whether or not the input PSF is spatially oversampled

param.name: ltan
param.help: Local Time of Ascending Node of satellite orbit used for stray light file: 6am or 6pm

param.name: altitude
param.help: Altitude of satellite orbit in km used for stray light file

param.name: pointingRA
param.help: RA of pointing direction for stray light file in radians

param.name: pointingDec
param.help: Declination of pointing direction for stray light file in radians

param.name: jitterOffset
param.help: Omit the first m_jitterOffset seconds from the jitter file
